title: Derivative of arcsine using a difference quotient

content.question: If <math> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi></mrow> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow> </munder> <mtext> </mtext><mfrac> <mrow> <mi>arcsin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mi>h</mi> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo></mrow> </math> which of the following could be the value of a ?
